89A6C6AD25974A66ABD8789DA94D3C9C.description: reflects on, analyzes, and assesses strategies used while learning Michif.

353B0AC61D514870B542F5DF8BC1B20A.description: determines personal inquiry and learning goals; and;

5E59BE6286294C039DBEBE0DC2081929.description: reflects on new knowledge of Michif and its value to self and the wider community;

712E223EF859429588A38BC5FAFC2ADD.description: determines personal inquiry and research strengths and language goals;

7851D7DB4D7C4D1DA6C5A6502C8531B1.description: reviews, refines, through reflection, feedback and selfassessment;

CA188FA577F84813A0E184FC268C4512.description: reflects on attainment of personal goals for effective language learning and use;

B50C670E3F644843AA2C3231EE5F52DE.description: assesses own and others' work for clarity, correctness, and impact;

7BEEFB1B08804472ADC52E96216D69C6.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language learning as they relate to family, community and land and set goals for future improvement.

082EF8E967644B63A4511E2B2513372A.description: uses criteria and rubrics to evaluate presentations including the purpose, delivery, content, visual aids, body language, and facial expressions.

3EFBE9E849EB44BDBA1A2D10217F31A8.description: evaluates and modifies own roles in group interactions; and

D01D940A40B94D5E93F541349136FE58.description: recognizes speaking, listening, viewing and representing are useful tools for clarifying thinking, communicating and learning;

5700E973AA2E44CBA32878753D5328F8.description: reflects on factors that influence identity through the use of the Michif language;

298FC3438E4F4985976470722DCAF6B6.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language skill, and set goals for future improvement.

179D63EC1590488EBA7002330F35F5CA.description: discusses options using words for possibility, comparison, contrast and cause; e.g., compare and contrast artwork done by Saskatchewan artists, or discuss the pros and cons of living in the city.

18120330FB1F409EB489D1D95DED0B94.description: gives a set of instructions with appropriate sequence, rules, conditions and imperatives, such as how to make jam using blueberries or raspberries, or how to clean and tan a moose hide; and,

B7EEBC4D0CF846398BB96B54101E19B1.description: describes or narrates an experience, event or situation with supporting detail; e.g., life on the trap line, prepare wild game, setting a fishnet, or educational experiences;

7B261A99E2934B2B8EFF89232FBA0C02.description: perform language functions that allow them to produce communication.

638F94B351DE4AC5875B4A091DB7D2E7.description: explores effective forms for recording and presenting and uses for research findings, such as CD-ROM's, video archives, children's literature; and,

559DD6197CE8465E84AA5003B268FF13.description: approaches cultural resource people with appropriate protocol for collecting information;

2B8B4D7D2C8745E5986907D3F592EDCE.description: identifies possible sources of information, resource people, written resources and media resources;

2691828BAB044C6BBDA8F2320F96076F.description: forms possible research or inquiry questions;

AE8D82ABD0D4457E9D6ABF8470E465B4.description: identifies and inquires a need or purpose for collecting cultural information in consultation with Elders;

865409704E974042869EEBB5EF6E2AC3.description: perform language functions that allow them to produce research

569E2DBFB2E1433F99B7B7F79F6AE79E.description: relates personally to a character or situation in moral stories.

CBE10D5D6F4842CEBACE4280C30A0BC4.description: after hearing/viewing/reading discourse: demonstrates by outlining, summarizing, paraphrasing and answering questions, comprehension of main idea and details; demonstrates recognition of language techniques used for effectiveness of presentation.

B9C4083506904E8C8E4184181DBAC3EC.description: engages in previewing or hearing activities that orient to the discourse, such as providing background knowledge, recalling what is already known;

2BD34F9D9724433EAB811CB1D4A19B55.description: perform language functions that allow them to interpret communication.

389334E80DEC48DBB558B2F5101B3952.description: demonstrates and uses language families and dialectssystematic sound differences and reasons for differences in vocabulary.

D115D7704DED46C181F7700FF3C30C88.description: uses language and other protocols governing relationships between and among people during ceremonies and special events; and,

5EAA154FD9F04FD7B1AC438F1312FA60.description: uses inclusive language to welcome guests into the home, school or community;

DF1BFD0998E84A0BAEA65434D4FFAA66.description: perform language functions that allow them to socialize and celebrate.

A931A02B791D414F9601045A1506383C.description: asks questions, asks for repetition to clarify understanding.

02185EDB1858473783474825D15811C2.description: seeks information to help formulate personal understanding; and,

F6AC12F15F60458AA9769BB4ABF2C9AC.description: develops ways of organizing and clarifying personal thinking and ideas;

9924FD91A1684E59AD58C4E5F7587888.description: uses questions to understand new idea;

8CBB9DE3D9314C988C4757F17DDD525E.description: uses Michif to persuade or convince;

F2C230FD1F084799B5DA2FEDBAACD123.description: follows simple instructions for doing something (e.g., brush teeth, wash face, get something);

BF01F85B619A4A208FBF1D78E8499296.description: discusses plans (e.g., going to the library, going for coffee, meeting for volleyball);

B3D09D8CE90C4171982BC33E0798C830.description: discusses plans (e.g., going to the library, going for coffee, meeting for volleyball);

C4281FA7B9F14736966A7A519885C137.description: perform language functions that allow the learner to receive and give information.

B48A9FA33DE24DF893D372CB3294F762.description: uses a variety of patterns in their own texts.

B214B4C2F0B4461D8209D6A5CE667CA4.description: uses a variety of conventions to structure texts (e.g., titles, poetry, and riddles/jokes); and,

69875C37855E45FEA4F263C9C661B3BF.description: uses a variety of short oral texts on unfamiliar topics in guided situations;

94E646318F0F472EAD35678B67500C58.description: uses simple linking devices appropriately in spontaneous speech to create a sense of flow and coherency;

80FDC0C13A9A4B77BF9CFEC6EA63D0E4.description: expresses some logical relations in discourse;

A0E53A3D44B1428B966A98472FC5C812.description: conveys an idea in discourse with a logical sequence of events and with simple but effective detail;

FD8F1B60EDEB4D8D8ED9C983A1F73114.description: communicate meaningfully with coherency (coherency relates to the connectedness of information, thoughts and ideas within discourse).

4AAEB3E4667141DBBD30C7DBDA523E11.description: produces basic phrases, short sentences, and questions using learned vocabulary and simple language structures.

066B8BC1443949479260695011835133.description: participates in a simple conversation with a Michif speaker using repetition and explanation; and,

6063AAF1D303488E8592B8F68BA210BD.description: manages simple, routine interactions with ease and asks for clarification when necessary;

7845A295812C41D0AF519479000565B9.description: produces speech at a normal or slower than normal rate that requires some repetition to be understood by a first language speaker;

3A4DC9F8982B42CD89BC3E83D03221A2.description: communicate meaningfully with proficiency (proficiency is the ability of an individual to speak or perform in an acquired language).

AD9E121C1F4C4D668A5E5A4612961A34.description: produces a variety of short, simple oral texts in guided and unguided situations.

25A3907529C245A6A46794BD52696E74.description: uses a wider range of common verbal affixes with relative accuracy; and,

369A4CD6ADAF463D97617FB053EBD151.description: produces sentences containing a subordinate clause;

8550E70423594897BDF934AF4352834E.description: uses specific vocabulary associated with a range of common topics;

FA7D120F73BE4E8290FD97AF6AB4D7D7.description: produces sounds of language that are difficult for the student learning an additional language, with enough clarity to prevent misunderstandings of common words;

E4D3EA8D573648779FB160A46AE24942.description: Communicate meaningfully with accuracy (accuracy primarily the syntactical and semantical conventions of a language).

0037E8339A54464291B40D2213C41253.description: identifies and develops own strengths related to Michif language and culture.

14C606646CC34E58945B0B8CD71852DF.description: identifies language and cultural role models (who they are and what makes them unique); and,

1952D55467EC431BBB4F7C17670C85A3.description: works with language mentors (e.g., parents, friends, peers, Eldersk) to monitor and improve own learning;

172030D1DD44433F92996E7CE380BB57.description: identifies effective mental techniques to improve learning Michif;

A1F689BDD6E9476DAE028F906C315492.description: demonstrates willingness to take risks and to try unfamiliar tasks and approaches;

8D227115480F440C8E2A7CCB27395A2E.description: asks for clarification or repetition to aid understanding;

6DA73AA52B9241EF97CFBFAF721A5654.description: repeats and uses new words and expressions occurring in conversation with others;

DB5B906124E24F3CB2668EC7DD7B2CD8.description: develops criteria for assessing own work;

D58579FED9244A7AA8700BC4D1468732.description: identifies problems that may hinder successful completion of a task and seek solutions;

D9F034F9BC3A473E9BBAC15F53E7D4BC.description: demonstrates how strategies may assist with texts containing unknown elements;

6FE5DD24325E4A299CA3CADE3D0599EB.description: demonstrates awareness of learning through direct exposure to Michif by asking questions when someone is speaking;

EC7352F3C0CD4F1C8A5D59E025BAD6C0.description: uses key content words or context clues to follow an extended text;

29D94D03FC3A41E188ED0C9FEB49651F.description: places new words or expressions in a context to make them easier to remember;

68FA6F061DA64C0C9B9316F56F217519.description: uses graphic representations (e.g., word maps, mind maps, diagrams, charts) to make information easier to understand and to remember;

038FA4E91C0041F088B96EB06E8C9A11.description: identifies and justifies the evidence on which inferences are based;

F1BA59C45C504373A08ED3643EFC8DEF.description: makes personal notes when hearing useful language;

02644EA0ACEC400B996A4287D1189690.description: volunteers initiating or ending a conversation;

781C29BAEEA447B4B8B115246D146DBB.description: seeks opportunities to use or hear the language;

E304F56C09E74527B4CCDE322CE8DB17.description: uses reference materials and speakers to help in clarifying a message;

40BA593CE7A943AF9046CAD646F326C2.description: uses grammatical knowledge to correct errors or to improve their language;

EE6F1BDACAD9407B9A1177E9D3C49393.description: distinguishes relevant information from irrelevant information when trying to get the gist of a speech or difficult conversation;

EB6322CFCAE24E73A865544A4AF154B7.description: decides in advance what to listen for;

32A6A23EF9C241DD80DB4C90065EFFE5.description: develop and use various strategies to enhance the meaning of learning and communication.

1FB453D894F24C92AF7ED59DF190FCB7.description: presents an oral narrative or other creative text and accompanies it with a visual, kinaesthetic or oral presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience, such as a poem put to music, script or dialogue acted out, or gives instructions on how to do a particular task.

DA23423BEB294632B2C37A769C485763.description: writes a factual report based on inquiry and presents information accompanying the written report with a visual, oral or kinaesthetic presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience; and,

EA43FECB642B4E649A7FF44D95AA7A77.description: writes notes and presents orally to capture basic information from inquiry or from a personal or electronic source, such as a short interview, weather report or short film;

255EDA8CD1284B0A8A45723CDB01959A.description: shares personal reflections created, such as a speech and as written text, in response to personal experiences or Michif world-views;

73EFC96857C14C738FB9547C5CB72DDF.description: retells parts of oral narratives orally and in written form, and combines with various mediums of expression, such as dance, puppetry, art, or drama;

690C409AB9994C0187C9C6C56B88C57B.description: communicates thoughts, ideas, feelings for specific purposes and audiences through a variety of verbal and visual media in guided situations;

32CE4572299E4788BCBF787B5229E658.description: produces text on familiar topics, providing detail to support main point, in guided situations;

E09076D87B5341689EEACC4C008A52E6.description: produce language that is understandable to others.

AE3AAB94CA614EBE840D7DC93E1B8DAD.description: reads and interprets a descriptive passage of text or a detailed set of instructions for a process, supported with occasional informative illustrations.

81B397EFC5154D3EA91FC973CEDB0F05.description: reads and interprets simple excerpts from stories from the oral tradition; stories should be supported with occasional informative illustrations, photos, or other visual representations; and,

989DCF0A4B0D49638BDD6F00A5868ED1.description: listens to and interprets some of the proceedings of community meetings regarding topics relevant to cultural areas of study, such as meetings with Elders, band council meetings, school committee meetings;

4374868BB0E04E298F8BA51D5A83F73B.description: interprets and responds to contemporary Michif reflections expressed in a variety of mediums, such as documentaries on a topic of choice, or modern Michif art, dance, drama, and music;

382CD6034DE8458C9D95073757325847.description: interprets and responds to traditional narratives of the people relating to areas of Michif worldviews: histories, moral stories, songs, informational texts and entertaining stories, from electronic or print mediums;

E6D458CB15CF4B2C9523A12A0DB0513C.description: understand and interpret the Michif language as a connected set of ideas expressed in sentences.

74465C0F95E5461DAD3CE8311C53C7A2.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people while inquiring about the Michif world-view to learn about the history, past practices and past customs.

CB5DC90939CA44569DDD3395959C693D.description: interacts with members of the community in acts of service to the community, such as helping with the preparation of activities, programming for community radio, television or print media; and,

BB0E5C06AA6A47BA91FC794FC144FABC.description: interacts with members of the community while participating in community events, such as winter festival, language festival, dance competitions or music festivals;

7D6349C69A8E4CA3A29F97B1452C17FF.description: interacts with members of the community and Elders while participating in culture camps;

4EB73B92566A426FB87FA4AB64B39F50.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people to learn cultural skills in the learners' natural surroundings;

6CC1EAA50B8B446EA190D734CEED78B2.description: listens and responds to a variety of extended text forms in a variety of media (e.g., short stories, films, plays, etc.);

9E54EC723B8C4291AC18E71F0380B4E6.description: identifies the main point and supporting details of lengthy texts on topics of interest in guided situations;

BAA8586790CB49108AC1CE35E131C355.description: identifies the purpose of texts (e.g., to describe, retell, persuade, entertain and instruct);

57265E0F4551499994DE8B466F4E4AAC.description: listens and responds to short texts on topics of interest in guided or unguided situations;

F11A85F79EF44ADEADE029A7E85AD6D1.description: view, interact with, and experience the natural and constructed environments of the community.
